intro: Schizopsis polyantha, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has linear to lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Schizopsis polyantha is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
